alert.note: Alert for City of Richmond; Henrico (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 17 at 3:08AM EDT until July 17 at 5:00PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Virginia... James River At Richmond Locks affecting City of Richmond and Henrico County. For the Lower James Basin...including Richmond Locks, Richmond Westham, Cartersville...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO LATE THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...James River At Richmond Locks. * WHEN...From this morning to late this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Minor flooding begins. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:54 AM EDT Monday the stage was 6.5 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate around flood stage with a maximum value of 8.1 feet late this morning. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 8.2 feet on 12/01/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this morning at 1000 AM EDT.
